pageContent: Introduction: Chronic inflammation may be important in prostate carcinogenesis. Several epidemiologic studies have reported inverse associations between nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) and prostate cancer risk, although many studies are limited by assessment of short-term use only.

metaData.source:
Targeted therapy with fatty acid synthase inhibitors in a human prostate carcinoma LNCaP/tk-luc-bearing animal model
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/22565411/
